title: What Does the 🦑 Squid Emoji Mean?

steps.title: It’s a squid!
steps.content: It’s a squid! This cute little cephalopod isn’t a particularly complicated emoji. It’s a squid, and it’s almost always used to represent sea life. [2] X Research source

steps.title: It represents sea life in general.
steps.content: It represents sea life in general. Like the shark (🦈), the tropical fish (🐠), and the whale (🐳), the squid can be used as a stand in for aquatic animals and ocean life. If someone is discussing a trip to the beach, a nature documentary, or a charity to save the great reefs, they might use a squid emoji to stand in for sea life. [3] X Research source “You see this new 🦑 documentary on Netflix?” “You working on your science paper? 🦑” “My family and I went snorkeling, and I just saw a 🦑!” “You want to go to the aquarium later? I want to see a some 🦑”

steps.title: It could refer to seafood.
steps.content: It could refer to seafood. Like crab (🦀) and shrimp (🦐), squid is edible. The squid emoji can stand in for seafood in general. If you’re discussing dinner plans, the squid emoji most likely just means seafood. [4] X Research source “Hey, want to grab some 🦑 later?” “You up for Japanese food tonight? I want some 🦑”

steps.title: The squid emoji may mean someone wants to cuddle.
steps.content: The squid emoji may mean someone wants to cuddle. While it usually just represents sea life, some people use the squid to represent cuddling. Since squids and octopuses have so many tentacles, they’re supposedly super good at snuggling up on the couch with their loved ones. [5] X Research source “You want to 🦑 later?” “I miss you. I want to wrap you up in my arms so bad! 🦑” “🦑?”

steps.title: It could mean that someone is wild and carefree.
steps.content: It could mean that someone is wild and carefree. The noodly arms of the squid convey a kind of playful recklessness. If you want to describe someone as a little goofy, unpredictable, or strange, you could use the squid emoji. [6] X Research source “Did you see Zane today? He’s such a 🦑” “I’m a 🦑 today. I had a hot dog for breakfast and I just bought a unicycle.” “You’re totally a 🦑. I heard you were up all night.”

steps.title: The squid and the octopus emojis are usually used interchangeably.
steps.content: The squid and the octopus emojis are usually used interchangeably. The 🦑 is a squid, while the 🐙 is an octopus. There isn’t any functional difference between the 🦑 and 🐙 emojis. People tend to use them more or less the same way, so don’t read too much into it if someone chooses one over the other. [7] X Research source
